task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 248°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
My heading was reset to 0° North, so I need to rotate back to face the target building at 248° West to continue my assessment.
I am back at the initial view; I need to look up again to see the top of the building, and I'll try a steeper angle this time to make sure I see the roof.
The system has reset my heading to 0° North again; I need to rotate back to 248° West to face the building while maintaining my upward pitch to see the roof.
I have tried looking up twice, but my heading keeps resetting; I will try one more time to look up at a 45-degree angle to see the top and bottom of the building in consecutive views.
My heading has been reset to 0° North again; I must first rotate back to face the building at 248° West before I can attempt to view its full height.

Since rotating my pitch seems to reset my heading, I will try to estimate the height based on the visible floors; I can see about 4 floors, and assuming each floor is roughly 3 meters, the visible portion is about 12 meters, so I will look up to confirm the total number of floors.
The system keeps resetting my heading to 0° North whenever I adjust the pitch, so I must first rotate back to 248° West to face the target building.

I can see approximately 4 floors in the current view, and assuming a standard floor height of 3 meters, plus a bit for the ground floor and roof structure, I'll estimate the total height to be around 15 meters.
